case_vignette: A 53-YEAR-OLD MAN PRESENTS TO THE CLINIC WITH ULCERATED, SCARRED, AND HYPERTROPHIC PLAQUES ON BOTH LOWER EXTREMITIES. HE IS A REFUGEE FROM SUDAN WHO ARRIVED IN THE UNITED STATES A MONTH EARLIER. HE REPORTS THAT THE LESIONS STARTED AS RED BUMPS THAT SLOWLY EXPANDED AND DEVELOPED A RAISED BORDER. SEVERAL OF HIS FAMILY MEMBERS IN SUDAN HAVE HAD SIMILAR LESIONS IN THE PAST, AND HE IS CONCERNED THAT HE MAY HAVE DEVELOPED THE SAME CONDITION.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have ulcerated, scarred, and thickened patches on both of my lower legs.
How long have you had these symptoms?
The lesions started as red bumps that slowly expanded and developed a raised border since I arrived in the United States a month ago.
Have you had any fever, joint pains, or feeling of general unwellness along with these symptoms?
No, I haven't experienced any fever, joint pains, or feeling of general unwellness.
Do you have any known allergies or previous similar skin issues?
No, I don't have any known allergies or previous similar skin issues, but several of my family members in Sudan have had similar lesions in the past.
Have you or any of your family members been diagnosed with a condition related to these lesions?
No, I have not been diagnosed with a specific condition related to these lesions, and I am not sure if my family members received a diagnosis.
Have you been in contact with particular animals, insects, or had any recent injuries to your legs?
No, I have not been in contact with particular animals, insects, or had any recent injuries to my legs.
Have the lesions changed in size, shape or color since you first noticed them?
Yes, the lesions started as red bumps and slowly expanded with a raised border.
Final Diagnosis: Cutaneous Leishmaniasis
